edu.uw.cs.cse461.net.base
Class NetBase

java.lang.Object
  edu.uw.cs.cse461.net.base.NetBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
NetBaseInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
NetBaseConsole
public abstract class NetBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetBaseInterface

A singleton class (only one instance can exist) implementing core network stack functionality. After initialization, normally the driver code will call startApp() on some initial app given in the config file. Shut down is done by calling shutdown(). Its major responsibility is to bring up services, like rpc, and make them available to apps (via getService()).

Check NetBaseInterface.java for a more concise list of the interfaces available to other code.

Note that some of the functionality of this class requires code specific to either console or Android execution. Thus, the concrete object of this class that is created (by either ConsoleStart or AndroidStart) is of a subclass. (See the NetAndroidOnly and NetConsoleOnly projects.)

Author:
zahorjan

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Shutdown associated services and the network. The main point is to terminate threads, so that app can terminate. If you don't shut down various services, the odds are the app won't terminate even if the main thread exits.

Specified by:
shutdown in interface NetBaseInterface
